title: Welp it seems like Riot has ruined ranked for everyone at this point.
body:
Solo queuers get screwed because we don't have a solo queue, and now dynamic queuers are getting screwed because basically everyone is gonna look at that badge and consider them boosted regardless of whether or not that is true.

Dynamic queue has done nothing but make a mess of this community.

replies.body: Its hilarious how stupid this company handles a simple problem, they fucked up with the new que, no matter what they do they will always fuck their solo playerbase with that system. It was a REALLY REALLY REALLY stupid and retarded idea to think " lol lets just merge soloque and 5 vs 5 Matchmaking, this will be so much fun and engaging". No matter what they do, the basic idea of Dynamic Que is completly retarded. But hey, riot wont admit they did something wrong so they wont change it anyway. Its comical how they try to make everything good again with badges, who gives a fuck about badges guys, come on.

The whole season is a joke. High lvl players are hardly trying to climb, they spend more time boosting or smurfing low mmr games which then hurts the lower mmr players. Unless of course you have that high mmr friend boosting you, in which case again the solo players are the ones getting the shaft.

I have no motivation climbing back into Diamond.

I had several friends I know who've been bronze for 2 season, they both found couple of Diamond friends who boosted them into high plat. 

This season is a joke.

I'm not going into diamond either...

But that's just because I'm bad.

# #Bronze4Ever
What's that - matchmaking's a joke with DQ?  How about if I give you a gold star for playing solo?  All better now?!

Wtf do you mean by "it isn't wrong to them"? Don't make a fcking joke of yourself. They made this game for the players. Guess who they are. Me and you fam. So if it's wrong to us (in this case, solo players), then they should at least listen to us and fix it. I'm tired of players like you defending riot whenever they screw up.

Best part is, they continuously hide behind what they believe to be a failure in the execution. That Roundtable video proved it. They kept calling DQ and the associate problems "fucked up" or "shit" but they just affirmed that they would slap on some "iterative improvements" and other fancy words (@RiotSocrates) and the issues would just go away. Quite the opposite. The problem is in the principle. No matter how many band aids you put on this, no matter how statistically "fair" DQ becomes, the premise of allowing premades in the same queue with solo players causes an un-level playing field. Done. The problem is not the execution, but the principle. And Riot either doesn't see that or refuses to, and I'm not sure which is worse.

And 15 years from now no one will care about if you played ranked with friends or solo...

I play a crap load of league, and I dont spend my time on the boards crying about DQ or whichever champion nerf or whatever insignificant issue. The super tryhard, win or threaten to report your whole team, take every game so serious that you tell teammates to kill themselves and rip your hair out like a neurotic gerbil over in-game events mentality killed this community. Not dynamic queue.

Probably in the history of video games there has never been a game like league where a bunch of people who play hours daily bring themselves to the official message boards and spam conspiracy theories about the company who made it because they don't like some aspect or change.

Anything Riot does will get called out as "ruining" one thing or another. Trying to please the boards audience is like trying to convince your cat to breakdance. You all piss and moan and cry about every little change, yet spend hours and days of your life playing league. Oh lord, life is so tough.

Man, we all hate Riot for making this game. zzzz

DynaQ was a response to the fact that SoloQ had some of the worst online gaming conditions you could consistently achieve without any input whatsoever. You just had to join a game and people didn't want to be there with you; you just had to pick a champ and you already lost, which was already all your fault.

I don't think DynaQ is quite the answer, sure, but there's a pretty solid problem with your players when you're straight-up worse than World of Warcraft's players.

It's in lieu of them actually grabbing their nuts and seizing down on crappy behavior, or in lieu of them doing something to discourage or prevent smurfs. It's a band-aid, and it unfortunately seems like you'll all just have to deal for now.

In the meantime, it might behoove us as a community to be a bit more involved in the casting-down of poor sportsmanship; almost like if we had some sort of council, some sort of means by which we as a community could pitch our vote in on players' punishments... like some sort of tribunal.

To be fair, that's always been a thing though.

"Where did you buy your account?"
"Don't get your friend to push you to gold next time."

etc etc etc.
Blind pick is the new ranked
meanwhile us down in bronze don't care about this whole thing and just like being able to pick our roll.
The badge idea is just stupid. It doesn't change how matchmaking works so what's even the point. Like all it does is encourage people to argue over their teammates getting boosted.

Don't play dynamic que then. It's actually good incentive to not play dynamic, and more solo.

Also, people will always find a something to flame you for if they want to, and changing game around it is bad.

Doesn't help that they just screwed over ARAM with the last patch as well. I honestly feel like they were thinking " people have stopped playing norms & ranked, so let's make ARAM worse so we can get some ARAM players to play more normal & ranked."

^Don't even get me started on this.
I only managed to play a few ARAM games testing the changes on the pbe because all the other queues were still online so there were 45+ minute queues for ARAM there.  
Guardian items are garbage and a noobtrap.  The only decent one is {{item:3184}} , by a long shot.
I'm just glad they reverted removing {{item:3302}} from ARAM in an early iteration.
It's gonna be a long while before ARAM settles down again.

oh wait, they put {{item:3302}} back in? Well I have some tank Item sets to work on. What do you think should be done to fix ARAM? I heard from one person that they should revert the cooldown on {{summoner:4}} back to what it was so marksman can't escape from melee champs as easily, I'd personaly like them to reduce the cooldown on {{summoner:32}} back to what that was or reduce it even further since they made the hit box smaller.

Yeah they were gonna scrap it but didn't.  Guardian items are crap.  
They should NOT be in every starting item set.

I haven't gotten used to the gold flow changes but the increased gold for kills and the minions starting at high gold makes it even more important to snipe last hits.  

The passive gold also makes turtleing when you're comp can't fight until 6 impossible; but it's a strategy you have to use sometimes depending on the champs you're dealt.
In this case you now lose in champ select.  I haven't seen a comeback yet.

I don't think the SS cooldown is a big deal.  
What is huge is the removal of all the ms engage items from the map, making snowball mandatory now for some.

Double edged sword is a big confounding culprit this patch as well, I don't know what that's doing to the map either.

I haven't faced a Teemo/Shaco as of yet, but how are we to kill the traps now?  
Oracles just reveals them in red untarget-able status.

The widening of the area near the base now makes it harder for the defending team to set stuff up; before we had a choke-point to get them and make a comeback.
Now you're probably better off fighting on the bridge without your turrets, to be brutally honest.

If they increased the nexus turret ranges and pushed them slightly forward it'd be a start.

There's other stuff, but I don't want to give a bigger wall of text :P
Maybe I'll put it all in one post; gonna take me a bit though...

Would be nice to see a post about this. I don't see a lot of people addressing the ARAM situation, which I mostly assume is cause of the whole Dynamic Q fiasco right now (seeing as it's apart of the main game it makes sense). 
I know Riot doesn't rely on the boards for decision making, but I do like to believe the boards at least lets them know that there might be an issue they should look into.

Wukong is pretty much all around good due to his ult (escapes are near impossible since you can see him in red), rengar suffers more but not necessarily to the point where he'll do much worse and eve is eve... the fact she's a big candidate for a rework next year says plenty.
